title: Groschopp, Inc. Whitepaper: How to Test and Evaluate Fractional Horsepower Motors in Your Application
text:
Testing and evaluating the motor in a motion application, whether it is a new application or a redesign of a current application, is an important part of the design process. Identifying the application input requirements allows the designer to work more effectively with the motor manufacturer to obtain the best motor for the application, allowing the engineer to choose the optimal design and have a successful product launch.
Sioux Center, Iowa (PRWEB) October 12, 2015
Groschopp, Inc.’s whitepaper How to Test & Evaluate Fractional Horsepower Motors in Your Application discusses the specifications and processes needed to properly determine the optimal fractional horsepower motor for an application by knowing the application inputs and testing the application to obtain actual performance requirements.
Understanding the Application Input
Input Power Load & Speed Load Profile Packaging & Environment
Testing the Application
Estimate the Application Loads Determine the Actual Loads Establish the Specification Optimize the Design
This whitepaper focuses on what testing and evaluations can be done to understand if a selected electric motor is best for the application. This is important because a system with too small of motor may not be able to perform the intended task or may not meet the life requirements; a system with too large of motor may add too much weight, size, or cost to the system. A good understanding of the application and how to evaluate the motor in that application will allow for optimized results.
Website: http://www.groschopp.com/whitepaper/how-to-test-evaluate-fractional-horsepower-motors-in-your-application/
